body: Alright, my other one was taken down of a person who could of started a flame war. Please list me some PvP techniques that I could practice on so I can improve and so I can have a decent fight with Jozzeh and Theo (#TooOPForMe). Also me and Yoav are fighting each other #1vs1Buddies. Finally, elaborate on your suggestions pls, maybe link me to a video or something!

title: Any PvP Tips Please?

replies.body:
practice - focus on different bits at a time.
Go on badlion 1v1s.
First match, stare at your corsshair to make your aim.
Second match focus on your CPs
Third match do strafes and go on for there.



Tracking: try to circle strafe a fence in survival and break it

replies.body:
Have a good FOV. Quake Pro is very good, as it allows you to see wider.
Strafing around bow spammers, archers etc is better than just standing there.
Jump as you hit.
Press f3 and b at the same time, so you can see player's hit boxes. You'll be able to see where you can hit.

replies.body:
Always try to have to upper hand (eg. Armour, surprise, team support)

When in a small space try to jump the enemy, blockhit and crit.

When in an open space bowspam then rush, rely on combos.

Try not to walk into a group of enemies unless you know you have the advantage.

Practice on Badlion and Kohi, also OCN can be used if you want a bit of a challenge (No offence avicus players)
replies.body_tagged:
Always try to have to upper hand (eg. Armour, surprise, team support)

When in a small space try to jump the enemy, blockhit and crit.

When in an open space bowspam then rush, rely on combos.

Try not to walk into a group of enemies unless you know you have the advantage.

Practice on Badlion and Kohi, also OCN can be used if you want a bit of a challenge (No offence avicus players)

replies.body:
What I do is try to make the enemy follow me and then get into a confined space. Then, I block-hit and 90% of the time, win :3
If there's no confined area around, I just start out strafing and once they get a couple hits on me, I go to block-hitting <3

replies.body: The goal is to keep moving and spin around your opponent while hitting him.  Your opponent won't be able to hit you as much because you are always behind him.  Make sure you get the first hits off of him and keep jumping to a min because of all damage.

replies.body:
justinrockslegos, you shouldn't post anything irrelevant to the topic that is discussed. The fact that you will get unbanned will be up to the staff. 

I do have a few tricks for archery PvP.
Anticipate where the enemy is going, calculate the speed he's running at, and fire at the spot where he's going to reach. Believe me, the calculations may seem hard, but It's done very quickly in your head.

Sword skills?
Try to perform a knocback, it may cause fall damage for the opponent, and it may help you get a head start if you are in trouble. I believe knocback can be performed by jump-sprinting while attacking.

That's all the PvP tricks I have.

That's all the PvP tricks I have.

replies.body: Actually, in my experience I got more knockback by sprinting and strafing without jumping. You can get eZ combos and make it harder to get combo'd by doing that. It takes practice, but it's worth it. (Thanks to Zieno for pointing that out to me)
replies.body_tagged: Actually, in my experience I got more knockback by sprinting and strafing without jumping. You can get eZ combos and make it harder to get combo'd by doing that. It takes practice, but it's worth it. (Thanks to Zieno for pointing that out to me)

replies.body:
@midnightbeats If your able to caculate the person's movement its actually not that hard to hit them it just takes practice :D

As for me im not the best pvper but strafing and getting behind your opponent always gives you an advantage(unless your opponent hacks) sometimes i even risk getting fall damage just to get behind your enemy and it actually sometimes works.
When your in a tunnel what I do i jump and sprint cause you know you go super fast if you do this then all you do is zoom behind them while hitting to get the upper advantage.
In archery warfare getting the upper advatage isnt always better in a sense because if you dont have a roof above your head its actually easier to hit the person above you it may not work all the time but it sometimes does... Also when your opponent is dodging your arrows wait and charge your bow up and shoot only when your enemy is charging their bow so it is easier to land a hit on him/her.

Those were some of my tips/tricks some other stuff are trade secrets :P
replies.body_tagged:
@midnightbeats If your able to caculate the person's movement its actually not that hard to hit them it just takes practice :D

As for me im not the best pvper but strafing and getting behind your opponent always gives you an advantage(unless your opponent hacks) sometimes i even risk getting fall damage just to get behind your enemy and it actually sometimes works.
When your in a tunnel what I do i jump and sprint cause you know you go super fast if you do this then all you do is zoom behind them while hitting to get the upper advantage.
In archery warfare getting the upper advatage isnt always better in a sense because if you dont have a roof above your head its actually easier to hit the person above you it may not work all the time but it sometimes does... Also when your opponent is dodging your arrows wait and charge your bow up and shoot only when your enemy is charging their bow so it is easier to land a hit on him/her.

Those were some of my tips/tricks some other stuff are trade secrets :P

replies.body:
People might hate me for this but try blockhitting
But dont just click randomly, try to guess when your opponent is going to hit you and block at the rigjt time
Combine that with strafing and your good
Ofc, thats what i do

Never jump crit unless you are in the middle of a combo, as the jump will get you knocked back more

As for bows, dont think too much about it
Unless there is limited arrows, aim in a general area around the player and fire (remembrr that the arrows go in an arc so aim a little high dependig on the distance)

Also, NEVER RUN HEAD ON AT A PERSON
They will bowspam the crap out of you :L

replies.body: People are telling you to crit, but this makes you an easy target for a heavy combo wombo-ing. Don't jump too much unless cornered, if you are, jump and block hit. Sprint all the time, it gives you such an edge, learn to use the bow effectively, practice different strafe patterns or whatever in Badlion 1v1s (I'd recommend UHC, OCN Iron or OCN.
replies.body_tagged: People are telling you to crit, but this makes you an easy target for a heavy combo wombo-ing. Don't jump too much unless cornered, if you are, jump and block hit. replies.body:
Okay, 
First in Nebula, some maps have useful things like gravel for flint and also cobwebs for string. Use these to make flint and steel or fishing rods.
Strafing is your best friend and bows.

Try using your bow more often and use it when you have a good distance apart so around about 6 blocks. When you shoot with bows don't bow spam.. Just do double-charge, it will do a good amount of damage and also good amount of speed. When shooting at long range, always fully charge your bow to get maximum aim and power. 

Next is strafing. There is mainly 2 types of it: circle strafing or zig zag. Circle strafing is what most people do but zig zagging it more effective where you move left and right to dodge the enemy's attacks. 

Tips to help: Change your FOV (Field of Vision) to Quake Pro may help because you can see further around you.
Change your mouse sensitivity to about when you move your mouse left to right, it will do a 90-180 degrees turn. So it will be much easier to aim. 

Thanks for for reading this! Hope it helps 
Lawrence
replies.body_tagged:

replies.body: Thanks for all your tips! I will take this all of this into my mind and I will hail the god "Cayden" The Strafing King! Also I will lower down my click speed (#WayToFastxD). I have also saw that putting your FOV on 100 improves your PvP drastically than Quake Pro. I practice the following techniques; Strafing (Lord Cayden), Blockhitting, Bow Accuracy, Vary Blockhitting Normal Hitting Critical Hitting(Jumping) and Shift Hitting for appropriate situations, Use F3+B for an appropriate manner, Practice on OCN, Badlion, Kohi, Do More Knockback and Use Sweg Hacks xD! Thanks for all your contribution to the practice of my PvP Skills. Now, off to practice!
